title: Murmurations and ratios conjectures
abstract:
Subject to GRH, we prove that murmurations arise for primitive quadratic
Dirichlet characters, and for holomorphic modular forms of prime level tending
to infinity with sign and weight fixed. Moreover, subject to ratios
conjectures, we prove that murmurations arise for elliptic curves ordered by
height, and for quadratic twists of a fixed elliptic curve. We demonstrate the
existence of murmurations for these arithmetic families using results from
random matrix theory.
